title: Jenna Ortega
content:
{{Short description|American actress (born 2002)}} {{pp-vandalism|small=yes}} {{Use American English|date=June 2022}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2022}} {{Infobox person | name = Jenna Ortega | image = Jenna Ortega 2022 (cropped).jpg | caption = Ortega in 2022 | birth_name = Jenna Marie Ortega | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|2002|9|27}} | birth_place = [[Coachella Valley, California]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Actress | years_active = 2012–present | television = | awards = | module = {{Infobox person|embed=yes | signature = | signature_alt = Jenna Ortega signature}} | module2 = {{Listen|pos=center|embed=yes|filename= Jenna Ortega vocal excerpt.ogg|title=Jenna Ortega's voice|type=speech|description=On how she made the [[Wednesday (TV series)|2022 version of ''Wednesday'']] appeal to fans of [[The Addams Family (1991 film)|the 1991 film]]
Recorded December 2022}} }} '''Jenna Marie Ortega''' (born September 27, 2002) is an American actress. She began her career as a [[child actress]], receiving recognition for her role as young [[Jane Villanueva|Jane]] in [[The CW]] comedy-drama series ''[[Jane the Virgin]]'' (2014–2019). Her breakthrough role came in portraying [[List of Stuck in the Middle characters|Harley Diaz]] in the [[Disney Channel]] series ''[[Stuck in the Middle (TV series)|Stuck in the Middle]]'' (2016–2018), for which she won an [[Imagen Awards|Imagen Award]]. She played [[Ellie Alves]] in the [[You (season 2)|second season]] of the thriller series ''[[You (TV series)|You]]'' in 2019 and starred in the family film ''[[Yes Day]]'' (2021), both for [[Netflix]]. Ortega received critical praise for her performance in the teen drama film ''[[The Fallout (film)|The Fallout]]'' (2021), and went on to star in the slasher films ''[[Scream (2022 film)|Scream]]'' and ''[[X (2022 film)|X]]'' (both 2022), and ''[[Scream VI]]'' (2023). In 2022, she began starring as [[Wednesday Addams]] in the Netflix horror comedy series ''[[Wednesday (TV series)|Wednesday]]'', for which she received nominations at the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy|Golden Globe]] and [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series|Screen Actors Guild Awards]]. == Early life == Jenna Marie Ortega{{Cite instagram |author=Disney Channel |user=disneychannel |postid=BHvpXM1B36M |title=Fun facts about @jennaortega! #stuckinthemiddle |url-status=live |date=2016-07-12 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/s/instagram/BHvpXM1B36M |archive-date=2021-12-26 |url-access=registration |website=[[Instagram]] |access-date=2022-12-13}}{{cbignore}} was born on September 27, 2002, in [[Coachella Valley]], California, the fourth of six children.{{cite web|title=Disney Channel – Stuck in the Middle – Bios |url=http://www.disneyabcpress.com/disneychannel/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php?action=dap_drawer&id=4510&type=bio |website=DisneyABCPress |access-date=April 21, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160501190048/http://www.disneyabcpress.com/disneychannel/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php?action=dap_drawer&id=4510&type=bio |archive-date=May 1, 2016 |url-status=dead }} Her father is of Mexican descent and her mother is of Mexican and Puerto Rican ancestry.{{cite news|url=https://www.popsugar.com/latina/Jenna-Ortega-Her-Mexican-Puerto-Rican-Background-42227222|title=Jenna Ortega: "I Am Extremely Proud of Where I Come From"|last1=Ortega|first1=Jenna|date=October 1, 2016|work=Pop Sugar|access-date=July 29, 2017|archive-date=July 29, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170729145054/https://www.popsugar.com/latina/Jenna-Ortega-Her-Mexican-Puerto-Rican-Background-42227222|url-status=live}}{{cite news|url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/jane-the-virgin-jenna-ortega-fights-anti-immigration-rhetoric|title=Jane the Virgin's Jenna Ortega Fights Anti-Immigration Rhetoric|last1=Leonowicz|first1=Rex|date=August 15, 2016|work=Teen Vogue|access-date=August 21, 2016|archive-date=August 29, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160829002302/http://www.teenvogue.com/story/jane-the-virgin-jenna-ortega-fights-anti-immigration-rhetoric|url-status=live}} Due to her career, Ortega has not "really lived a normal lifestyle"; she has also expressed regret at missing the traditional high school experience and teenage milestones such as prom and graduation. == Career == === 2012–2017: Early acting roles and Disney === Ortega had become interested in acting from the age of six. Two years later, after her mother posted a video of Ortega doing a dramatic monologue on Facebook, Ortega got an agent and started getting auditions.{{cite magazine|last=Rodriguez|first=Priscilla|date=April 15, 2016|title=EXCLUSIVE: Jenna Ortega on 'Stuck in the Middle' and Why Gina Rodriguez is Her Idol|url=https://www.latina.com/entertainment/celebrity/jenna-ortega-stuck-middle-exclusive-interview|magazine=[[Latina (magazine)|Latina]]|access-date=August 30, 2022|archive-date=April 23, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423202926/https://www.latina.com/entertainment/celebrity/jenna-ortega-stuck-middle-exclusive-interview|url-status=dead}} She soon made her acting debut in 2012 with a guest appearance for [[Rob (TV series)|''Rob'']], in the episode "Baby Bug."{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/listings/20120206cbs05/|title=Rob – The Baby Bug episode|website=TheFutonCritic.com|access-date=April 23, 2016|archive-date=June 27, 2016|archive-url=https://archive.today/20160627150241/http://www.thefutoncritic.com/listings/20120206cbs05/|url-status=live}} Following this was an appearance on ''[[CSI: NY]]'' on the episode "Unspoken" as Aimee Moore.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/listings/20121011cbs07/|title=CSI: NY – Unspoken episode|website=TheFutonCritic.com|access-date=April 23, 2016|archive-date=June 27, 2016|archive-url=https://archive.today/20160627150241/http://www.thefutoncritic.com/listings/20121011cbs07/|url-status=live}} In 2013, she made her film debut with a minor role in the superhero movie ''[[Iron Man 3]]'' as the vice president's daughter. Following this, Ortega starred in the horror film ''[[Insidious: Chapter 2]]'', the second film in the [[Insidious (film series)|''Insidious'' franchise]], as Annie, a supporting role. Both films were successful at the box-office.{{Cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl1532659201/|title=Iron Man 3|website=Box Office Mojo|access-date=2020-01-13|archive-date=December 15, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171215142914/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=ironman3.htm|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl3445327361/|title=Insidious: Chapter 2|website=Box Office Mojo|access-date=2020-01-13|archive-date=January 13, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200113202548/https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl3445327361/|url-status=live}} In 2014, Ortega was cast in the role of Zoe Leon on the series ''[[Rake (Australian TV series)|Rake]]'', and from 2014 to 2019, played the recurring younger version of Jane on the romantic-drama series ''[[Jane the Virgin]]''.{{Cite web|date=2019-12-30|title=9 [[Netflix original]] series ''[[Richie Rich (2015 TV series)|Richie Rich]]'' as part of the main cast, playing Darcy,{{Cite money even without his consent; the show was panned.{{Cite web|url=http://www.bdcwire.com/binge-watching-netflixs-richie-rich-is-five-hours-i-will-not-get-back/|title=Binge Watching Netflix's 'Richie Ortega then went on to star in the lead of the [[Disney Channel]] sitcom ''[[Stuck in the Middle (TV series)|Stuck in the Middle]]'' as Harley Diaz, the middle child of the seven Diaz siblings who is an aspiring inventor.{{cite magazine |first=Elizabeth |last=Wagmeister |url=https://variety.com/2015/tv/news/stuck-in-the-middle-jenna-ortega-disney-channel-comedy-series-1201586172/ |title=Disney new series 'Stuck in the Middle,' starring 'Jane the Virgin's' Jenna Ortega, Variety has learned exclusively. |archive-date=March 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160314095717/http://variety.com/2015/tv/news/stuck-in-the-middle-jenna-ortega-disney-channel-comedy-series-1201586172/ |url-status=live }} Ortega's performance garnered her an [[Imagen Award]] nomination for Best Young Actor – Television; she later received two more nominations for her work on the same show, including a win in 2018. In the same year, she joined the cast on Disney's ''[[Elena of Avalor]],'' as the voice of Princess Isabel, which ended in 2020.{{Cite web|title=Princess Elena's Heroic Journey to Become Queen Continues in the Third Season of "Elena of Avalor," Premiering Monday, Oct. 7|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2019/09/17/princess-elenas-heroic-journey-to-become-queen-continues-in-the-third-season-of-elena-of-avalor-premiering-monday-oct-7-298505/20190917disney01/|access-date=2020-10-20|website=www.thefutoncritic.com}} In 2017, she starred in the music video for [[Jacob Sartorius]]' "[[Jacob Sartorius discography|Chapstick]]", which also stars the singer. In the video, Ortega played Sartorius' love interest, which gained significant media coverage. === 2018–2020: Transition to mainstream roles === [[File:Jenna Ortega 2020.jpg|thumb|left|Ortega in 2020]] In 2018, Ortega starred in the film ''Saving Flora'' as the lead role of Dawn, the daughter of a circus owner.{{Cite web|last=Prahl|first=Amanda|date=March 28, 2022|title=Jenna Ortega's Résumé Has Everything From Disney to Horror Flicks|url=https://www.popsugar.com/node/47051355|access-date=March 7, 2023|website=Popsugar Entertainment|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220420144405/https://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/what-has-jenna-ortega-been-in-47051355?stream_view=1|archive-date=April 20, 2022|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|last=McNary|first=Dave|date=2017-08-04|title=David Arquette, Jenna Ortega to Star in Elephant Drama 'Saving Flora'|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/david-arquette-jenna-ortega-saving-flora-1202515546/|access-date=2020-01-14|website=Variety|archive-date=September 25, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925164051/https://variety.com/2017/film/news/david-arquette-jenna-ortega-saving-flora-1202515546/|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|date=3 August 2017|title='Jane the Virgin' Actress Jenna Ortega to Star in 'Saving Flora'|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/jane-virgin-actress-jenna-ortega-star-saving-flora-1026749|access-date=2020-10-22|website=www.hollywoodreporter.com|archive-date=October 23, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201023180906/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/jane-virgin-actress-jenna-ortega-star-saving-flora-1026749|url-status=live}} The film received positive reviews from critics, and Ortega received praise for her performance. She received a nomination for Best Lead Actress at the [[Southampton|Southampton International Film Festival]].{{Cite web|title=Southampton International Film Festival (2018)|url=https://www.imdb.com/event/ev0002169/2018/1/|access-date=2020-01-25|website=IMDb|archive-date=August 18, of the [[Netflix]] thriller series ''[[You (TV series)|You]]'', which was released on December 26, 2019.{{Cite smart and meddling girl who likes to act older than her true age.{{Cite commented on working with co-stars [[Penn Badgley]] and [[Victoria Pedretti]], stating that "I wish I had gotten to shoot with Victoria more, because I think she's really talented. ... Penn is such an eloquent speaker, so well-thought and so respectful and so kind, and just such a pleasure to work with."{{Cite web|last=Monteil|first=Abby|title=Jenna Ortega On 'Yes Day,' Being Latina In Hollywood, & Those 'You' Theories|url=https://www.elitedaily.com/p/from-you-to-yes-day-jenna-ortegas-career-has-her-booked-busy-64878145|access-date=2021-03-28|website=Elite Daily|archive-date=March 11, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210311150232/https://www.elitedaily.com/p/from-you-to-yes-day-jenna-ortegas-career-has-her-booked-busy-64878145|url-status=live}} The season, alike to the show's first season, was praised as well as Ortega's performance.{{Citation|title=You: Season 2|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/tv/you/s02|access-date=2020-01-22|archive-date=December 18, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191218205412/https://rottentomatoes.com/tv/you/s02|url-status=live}} In 2019, Ortega was cast as Phoebe in the Netflix horror film ''[[The Babysitter: Killer Queen]]''.{{Cite web|date=2020-09-10|title=Jenna Ortega in 'The Babysitter: Killer Queen:' A Different Role For The Former Disney Star|url=https://decider.com/2020/09/10/the-babysitter-2-killer-queen-jenna-ortega/|access-date=2021-01-17|website=Decider|archive-date=January 22, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210122181125/https://decider.com/2020/09/10/the-babysitter-2-killer-queen-jenna-ortega/|url-status=live}} She said in an segment with [[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]] that she had been "incredibly nervous" when they began filming, stating that "because it was a sequel, all of the other cast members already knew each other ... I went on the set panicking because I didn't know what I was doing."{{Cite web|last=Iwegbue|first=Annabel|date=2021-04-05|title=Jenna Ortega Walked Down Memory Lane During 'Breakdown On the action, Ortega told ''[[Forbes]]'': "I remember I was going through the news on my phone and I saw what Melania wore on the way to visit the immigrant children. In 2023, Ortega criticized the entertainment industry for seemingly misrepresenting [[Generation Z]] as not "smart". She further believed that recent media had a trend of portraying Gen Z in their teenage years as "bratty", "bad mouth teens", or "a lot of times unintelligent, which I don't think is true".{{Cite web |last=Rosenbloom |first=Alli |date=March 3, 2023 |title=Jenna Ortega wishes her generation was better represented in stories: 'We can be smart' |url=https://www.cnn.com/2023/03/02/entertainment/jenna-ortega-hot-ones/index.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230303082530/https://www.cnn.com/2023/03/02/entertainment/jenna-ortega-hot-ones/index.html |archive-date=March 3, 2023 |access-date=March 3, 2023 |website=CNN |language=en |url-status=live}} == Artistry and media image == [[File:Wednesday NYCC 2022 1 (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Ortega in 2022]] Ortega has stated that she feels taking more varied roles in acting is important to her, as to not be typecast; she told ''[[E! Online]]'' in 2021 that she did not want to be "pigeonholed as an actor,"{{Cite web |title=Jenna Ortega on Her Transition From Disney Star to Mature Roles |url=https://www.etonline.com/jenna-ortega-on-her-conscious-transition-from-disney-star-to-mature-roles-exclusive-162669 |access-date=2021-03-28 |website=Entertainment Tonight |archive-date=March 23, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210323214913/https://www.etonline.com/jenna-ortega-on-her-conscious-transition-from-disney-star-to-mature-roles-exclusive-162669 |url-status=live }} and that her desire to "do the most diverse roles that I possibly can and really switch up" made the transition to mature roles easier for her.{{Cite web|title=Jenna Ortega on Her Conscious Transition From Disney Star to Mature Roles (Exclusive)|url=https://www.wkyc.com/article/entertainment/entertainment-tonight/jenna-ortega-on-her-conscious-transition-from-disney-star-to-mature-roles-exclusive/603-8f6284c4-9f33-47d9-8d85-cab703e2c4a4|access-date=2021-03-28|website=wkyc.com|date=23 March 2021}} She has said that [[Horror film|horror works]] are what she feels most comfortable with starring in,{{Cite web |last1=March 14 |first1=Clark Collis |last2=EDT |first2=2022 at 03:00 PM |title='Scream,' 'Studio 666,' and 'X' star Jenna Ortega talks about her life in horror |url=https://ew.com/movies/x-star-jenna-ortega-talks-life-in-horror/ |access-date=2022-04-05 |website=EW.com |archive-date=April 5, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220405232913/https://ew.com/movies/x-star-jenna-ortega-talks-life-in-horror/ |url-status=live }} telling [[Rotten Tomatoes]] in 2022 that she was "pretty comfortable with all the horror stuff". In an interview with ''[[Collider (website)|Collider]]'', Ortega said that she was initially inspired to pursue acting after watching the performance of actress [[Dakota Fanning]] in the 2004 thriller film [[Man on Fire (2004 film)|''Man on Fire'']], stating that "After watching Dakota, who obviously was so talented from such a young age, I decided that I wanted to be the Puerto Rican version of her."{{Cite web|date=2021-03-13|title=Jenna Ortega on 'Yes Day', Riding Roller Coasters with Jennifer Garner, and Getting Cast in 'Scream' and Ti West's 'X'|url=https://collider.com/jenna-ortega-interview-yes-day-scream-ti-west-x/|access-date=2021-03-18|website=Collider|archive-date=March 18, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210318044007/https://collider.com/jenna-ortega-interview-yes-day-scream-ti-west-x/|url-status=live}} She also said that she thought [[Denzel Washington]] was "the coolest man I had ever seen in my life."
